attributes.action: Give all UK residents the right to vote in local government elections
attributes.background: There should be a change in electoral law to ensure that everyone who is permanently resident in the UK and of voting age has the right to vote in local government elections.
attributes.additional_details: For those who live in a local community, numerous aspects of their daily life – such as housing, education, local amenities, public transport, cultural and sports facilities – are influenced by decisions taken by the local authority. It is therefore only fair to extend the right to vote and be elected in local elections to all long-term UK residents, regardless of their citizenship. Such a move would also ensure that EU citizens retain their right to vote in local elections after Brexit.

attributes.action: Petition for annual increase for pensioners outside the EU Block.
attributes.background: My pension has been deferred for 5 years, by various Governments and now I find, I will not get yearly pension rises, because I am not in an EU country!

attributes.action: Increase the maximum prison sentence for animal cruelty to 10 years.
attributes.background: Sadly humans are not treated the same as other animals. This is completely wrong and this must be changed. So changing the prison sentence to 10 years will start to give all animals the rights they need.
attributes.additional_details: Right now the maximum prison sentence for animal cruelty is 6 months. There are plans to increase it to 5 years. This doesn’t go far enough, it needs to be 10 years.

attributes.action: Change religious slaughter law to mirror the licensing requirements in Germany
attributes.background: Change the laws to mirror those in Germany as outlined in House of Commons Library SN07108SES dated 18/02/2015. Germany requires licensing and the matching of volumes produced to actual needs for religious slaughtered products.Britain has no such defined requirement for monitoring or enforcement
attributes.additional_details:
House of Commons SN07108 dated 28/02/2015
DEFRA T02017 and RFI 9592
Volume of meat produced by religious slaughter over 50%
Religious groups requiring such produce 6%
Most meat on sale in UK supermarkets carry EEC codes that refer to establishments that practice religious slaughter but there is no requirement to restrict the sale or even label these products which denies british consumers choice and infringes on the religious freedoms of groups who religions forbid its use

attributes.action: Ban low letterboxes in UK on new build
attributes.background: I would like to see the UK Government amend building regulations & ban low letterboxes as has been the case in Ireland Since January 1st 2001
attributes.additional_details:
Letter  boxes should be postman friendly..Low boxes can cause serious injury when you have quite a few in a row or on a round whilst carrying a sack of mail.
 Even just one low letterbox is one too many.. You wouldn't put the keyhole down there so why put the letterbox down there.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for anyone to cover their face in public places
attributes.background: Face covering is a security risk, It would help prevent the steep rise in violent crime, prevent anonymity in marauding gangs and facilitate identification. Exception can be made for safety helmets while driving, and face coverings authorised by a doctor for medical reasons.
attributes.additional_details: In many Muslim countries women do not cover their faces. Security ID can be fooled by a face mask. This request is intended for the security of all including minorities.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all new homes in England and Wales to have solar panels
attributes.background: Solar panels reduce bills by allowing homes to generate some of their own electricity. Installing solar during construction can reduce costs by over a third and with storage they can halve electricity bills. Despite this, there is no meaningful regulation forcing house builders to install solar.
attributes.additional_details:
- The Government aims to build 300,000 new homes per year yet only 8,400 homes a year install solar [BEIS/HMTreasury]
- 400,000 people in Britain are in fuel poverty [Citizens Advice]
- The MyGridGB home with solar and battery storage has half the energy bill and carbon emissions of an average UK house. Over 65% of it's electricity comes from renewables [MyGridGB.co.uk] 
- Scotland already has a scheme to encourage solar on new build homes.
- The average solar install costs less than £4,500

attributes.action: Save the Borough of Poole.
attributes.background: We object to the proposed Future Dorset merger of Poole with adjacent councils. The public consultation was entirely flawed and Poole council's vote approving the merger was too narrowly based for such a sudden, profound and unnecessary reform. The residents of Poole do not want this merger.
attributes.additional_details:
The public consultation of 2016 was undebated, poorly advertised, designed simply to yield support for the plan and supported by analysis containing egregious errors.
The council decision showed a lack of unanimity for the abolision of a centuries-old borough. It was was not supported by any opposition councillors while the ruling group worked unreasonably to prevent any dissent within its own ranks.
The financial reasons used to justify the merger are erroneous and grossly misleading.

attributes.action: Rebuild the “Hereford, Hay and Brecon” and “Mid-Wales” railways
attributes.background: The Beeching cuts of the 1960s closed a significant number of lines in the Marches and mid-Wales, the return of which would boost the economy and vitality of the area. There would also be a potential reduction in road traffic and therefore of carbon emissions.

attributes.action: Debate a ‘National Strategy to Promote the Switch to Cloth Nappies.’
attributes.background: More families would switch to cloth with sufficient information and a financial incentive. Ringfence money so councils can effectively promote cloth through well resourced libraries, liaison with antenatal/ postnatal services and incentives. Hold manufacturers of disposable accountable to help fund.
attributes.additional_details:
In the UK, app 8 million nappies are thrown daily; app 3% of our household waste* (app. half a million tons, annually)**. One baby will produce app. 1 ton of waste*** which takes > 200 years to biodegrade. Disposable nappies also have greater environmental costs due to the production process. Those who use cloth tend to switch to reuseable wipes and bags, further reducing use of single use items.
Councils pay £88.95 p/tonne, in landfill tax.
*Veolia ** recyclingexpert.co.uk
*** kickscount.org.uk

attributes.action: Incorporate LGBT+ history in primary and secondary school education
attributes.background: By introducing education of LGBT+ history, promoting LGBT+ equality and diversity and the normalisation of same-sex relationships in primary and secondary schools, we can work with children across the UK to help fight and prevent discriminating, and encouraging acceptance in future generations.

attributes.action: Create a Charter for Families Bereaved through Public Tragedy
attributes.background: The Bishop's review of Hillsborough families' experiences recommends the creation of a Charter for Families Bereaved through Public Tragedy. The Government must implement this recommendation. This petition was started by bereaved relatives of family members who perished in the Grenfell Tower fire.
attributes.additional_details: The Charter will include commitments by public bodies to change in relation to transparency and acting in the public interest. By adopting this, the Government will show that it has learned the lessons of the Hillsborough disaster and ensure that the perspective of bereaved families is never lost. We’re concerned that the Grenfell public inquiry isn’t taking into account the views of bereaved families, survivors, and local community affected. They can be spared the indignities, pain and suffering Bishop James Jones describes in his report as "The Patronising disposition of unaccountable power".

attributes.action: Provide statutory anonymity for victims of homophobic & transphobic hate crime.
attributes.background: Being 'outed' is a barrier for victims to LGB&T hate crime reporting an incident to the Police and later attending court. Introducing statutory anonymity, as already given to victims of serious sexual assault, would remove this barrier, as well as removing the possibility of hostile media reporting.
attributes.additional_details:
1. LGB & T Hate Crime Reporting: Identifying Barriers and Solution, Equality Human Rights Commission (2015), page 31.
2. The Hate Crime Report: Homophobia, biphobia and transphobia in the UK, GALOP (2016), pages 8 - 9.
3. Homophobic Hate Crime: the Gay British Crime Survey (2013) pages 18 - 19.

attributes.action: Make domestic abusers sign a register
attributes.background: Domestic abuse will affect 1 in 4 women and 1 in 6 men in their lifetime and leads to, on average, two women being murdered each week and 30 men per year. By getting domestic abusers to sign a register, this could at least warn people before they decide to continue in a relationship with someone.

attributes.action: Ban paper receipts in the UK unless specifically requested by the customer.
attributes.background: Over 11 billion receipts are printed each year in the UK alone. The majority of these are discarded straight to the bin. This has a devastating effect on our environment and the future of our planet. We must stop receipts being handed out as a matter of habit and dramatically reduce this number.
attributes.additional_details: We live in a digital age where a receipt can be emailed at the click of a button. Eventually we should be phasing out paper receipts altogether, but for now the government need to take the first step of making it illegal for all shops and companies to hand out receipts without a customer specifically requesting one.

attributes.action: Make St. George's Day, 23rd April, a Public Holiday
attributes.background: St. Patrick's Day is a public holiday in Northern Ireland, why shouldn't the English celebrate their Patron Saint's Day with a Public Holiday?

attributes.action: Revise and implement strategies to improve the quality of life for care leavers
attributes.background:
From foster care to independence, the support care leavers receive is automatically reduced, and their voice is no longer heard. This makes it increasingly difficult for care leavers to progress into adulthood, compared to young people who grew up with their birth parents. 

This needs to change.

attributes.action: Allow and run a referendum in Wales to decide the future of the Welsh Assembly.
attributes.background: Over the past 20 years the many in Wales have become dissatisfied by the unnecessary bureaucracy known as the Welsh Assembly (WA).  Due to its ineffective and costly intervention at all levels of Welsh life it's time to have another referendum to allow us to decide if the WA should continue or not.
attributes.additional_details: There are many reasons why the Welsh Assembly (WA) should be dissolved.  These include excessive running costs each year.  A growing North/South Wales divide in terms of investment.  Anything that the WA does could be done by Welsh MPs in government.  The WA has gone against the wishes of Wales on leaving the EU. It appears to be nothing but a talking shop for already failed ideas and now wants to take on the role of government imposing laws and taxes that would further divide us from the UK.

attributes.action: Stop UK government funding the Syrian Civil Defence, AKA the "White Helmets."
attributes.background: Major questions have been raised about the actions of the Syrian Civil Defence, AKA the "White Helmets."

attributes.action: Ban the use of all non-recyclable packaging materials by 31st December 2020.
attributes.background:
It's crazy that we are still buying products with mixed packaging materials where part of it is recyclable and part of it not. 
I believe this means we recycle significantly less than we could as some people do not bother to sort it and just throw everything into the general rubbish.
attributes.additional_details: The need to reduce the use of landfill and to increase recycling is widely accepted and I believe this would be a major step forward to making a greener more sustainable future for our country and the world

attributes.action: Light beacons across the country on March 29th 2019 to celebrate Brexit
attributes.background:
At 11pm on March 29th 2019 our country will leave the EU.
To celebrate this historic and momentous occasion, we believe the Government should arrange for beacons to be lit from Lands End to John O'Groats and at all points in between.
attributes.additional_details:
After over 40 years of Brussels rule, we are finally leaving the EU.
Lighting beacons around the country would be a symbolic gesture celebrating our independence and sovereignty.

attributes.action: Require drivers to report a cat hit on the road
attributes.background: My cat was killed in a road accident, however this was not reported to the police, because this is not required by law. If a driver hits some animals they must report it to the police or face a £5000 fine, but this law doesn't cover cats. That should change.
attributes.additional_details:
The law as it stands:
 
If you hit an animal which is covered by The Road Traffic Act 1988 – namely, dogs, goats, horses, cattle, donkeys, mules, sheep and pigs you are legally required to report it to the police. But if you hit an animal not mentioned in the Road Traffic Act eg. a cat you are not required by law to report it.

attributes.action: Create a UK Register for  people convicted of Animal Cruelty, Abuse & Neglect
attributes.background: Please sign in support of a 'UK Animal Offenders Register', a central database which will consist of name, address and convictions of people who have been convicted of any form of animal cruelty and abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
The Public and Breeders / sellers of animals will be able  to check this central database. If it is found that someone who has been convicted of animal cruelty or abuse has a animal the supplier / breeder will be held liable and prosecuted. 
At the moment there is no law to stop anyone who has been convicted of animal cruelty doing this again elsewhere.
Stricter laws need to be implemented to help protect animals, heavier fines & longer prison sentences as well as a Animal Offenders Register.

attributes.action: Introduce a 10p disposable cup tax in the UK
attributes.background: Based on the success of the single use plastic bag tax of October 2015, a single use cup tax would help encourage more people to switch to reusable coffee cups, further reducing the UK's plastic waste output.
attributes.additional_details:
Michael Gove, Twitter, 6:37pm 20/11/17:
"Still haunted by last night's #BluePlanet2 - the imperative to do more to tackle plastic in our oceans is clear. We @DefraGovUK will work urgently to identify further action."

Many coffee shops like Costa and Starbucks offer customers the option to provide their own cup, usually encouraged by a small discount. This incentive, combined with the extra cost of a cup tax, should encourage many people to make a small sustainable change.

attributes.action: Change universal credit back to the previous benefit system that worked
attributes.background: Forced off ESA to attend a medical with someone unqualified to be forced onto universal credit which has left myself and many others below the poverty line and homeless!

attributes.action: Reconsider the Sugar Tax
attributes.background: With the introduction of the Sugar Tax looming large, consumers are being constantly let down by the attempts of companies to avoid the higher rate of sugar tax and as a result the formulas they are releasing contain much higher levels of artificial sweeteners.
attributes.additional_details:
For some, the full sugar version of a drink not only tastes superior, it has beneficial effects, especially for people with a sensitivity to said artificial sweeteners.

A key example is the halving of Sugar in Lucozade (a recommended drink for people with diabetes to combat hypoglycaemic events). This wasn't announced in enough time for diabetic nurses to alter their recommendations.

All the tax is doing is punishing adult consumers. Why should we suffer this draconian approach to obesity?

attributes.action: Make it illegal to wear service medals that you have not been awarded.
attributes.background: I am a Veteran of the Northern Ireland troubles and the Falklands War 1982. In both conflicts I lost friends. They did not see the medals that they had earned. It annoys me to see anybody wearing medals that they have not earned. I find it disrespectful to my friends and all the others who gave all.
attributes.additional_details: We are asked to sign a blank cheque, up to the value of our life. For this we may get a medal. To see somebody walking around wearing medals, who didn't serve or sign on, is disgusting. They have never put their life on the line. They have never been on active service and faced the enemy. Why should they be allowed to bring contempt upon the uniform of somebody who has come forward and protected the people of this country?

attributes.action: Rehouse our brave Armed Forces as a matter of priority
attributes.background: Veterans are supposed to have “priority” from Local authorities when it comes to affordable housing and health care under the Armed Forces Covenant but all too often this does not happen.
attributes.additional_details:
Estimates taken from charities Shelter and Crisis show almost 8,000 military heroes are currently homeless.  However, the Government does not keep accurate records. We believe that the Government should act as a matter of urgency and help our brave Armed Forces heroes in their hour of need. 
Rehouse our brave Armed Forces as a matter of urgency.
They have served our country. Now it is time for us to repay that debt.

attributes.action: Stiffer sentencing and more resources for the police to prioritise tool theft.
attributes.background: Tool theft is on the increase and has widespread and serious broad reaching consequences for victims and their dependents. Current legislation and policing is in effective and the consequences result in loss of income and loss of jobs for those who often can least afford it.
attributes.additional_details:
Social media is currently full of reports of theft from vehicles and business premises where the police are unable or unwilling to pursue the offenders.
These thefts result in serious financial difficulties for trades and businesses which often result in lost earnings and even job losses and closure of the business. Many businesses are at breaking point and potentially will start taking the law into their own hands which is entirely unacceptable but Increasingly likely.

attributes.action: Introduce domestic abuse awareness as part of life skills to the curriculum
attributes.background: On 21.01.2018 an innocent child lost her life to domestic abuse.  The term "domestic incident" was used, minimising the severity of domestic abuse, indicating that there is a lack of understanding of the complex cycle.  Without awareness of this crime, how are we able to protect our young people?
attributes.additional_details:
My name is Samantha Billingham and I am a survivor of domestic abuse.

It is easier to stop something happening in the first place than to repair the damage after it has happened and with mandatory awareness, we can do that.  The outcome of talking about domestic abuse will have a positive behaviour enabling our young people to deal effectively with the challenges that domestic abuse brings to life.

Awareness is powerful, it gives people choices, options, knowledge, which could just save a life.

attributes.action: Compulsary Subsidised Swimming Lessons for Children (ages 3-10 years) in the UK.
attributes.background:
Compulsory Swimming Lessons for Children up to the age of 10 in the UK is paramount in fighting the UK’s battle against accidental drownings.
“Taking part in in formal swimming lessons reduces the risk of drowning among children aged 1 to 4 years” (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, 2016)
attributes.additional_details:
Latest figures from the National Water Safety Forum (NWSF) show that 300 people died in accidental drownings in the UK last year.
The number of people aged 19 and under who drowned in the UK has risen by 25 per cent (Local Government Association 2017, National Water Safety, 2017)
Water Safety and Rescue Techniques combined with taught sessions will reduce the rate of accidental deaths due to drowning, and promote a deeper understanding at an early age of the risks associsated with Water Safety

attributes.action: Reduce the risk of flooding by halting major developments on our floodplains
attributes.background: We ask the government to act responsibly regarding safety to new and existing communities and show more environmental foresight. We ask for legislation to be passed that forbids strategic development  allocations from being situated within all flood zones or areas that impact upon them.
attributes.additional_details:
With the ever increasing impact of climate change, it is becoming more important than ever to avoid man-made disasters. Once the floodplain is developed, there is no turning back."
 The 2007 Pitt report said "wherever possible, new development should not take place in flood risk areas and that there should be a strong presumption against building on the floodplain.” This is currently not always adhered to where non flood plain options could be made available hence the requirement for legislation

attributes.action: Mandatory for alcoholic drinks to display the dangers of alcohol when pregnant
attributes.background: To help prevent foetal alcohol in children and raise awareness

attributes.action: I want to create a law to neuter domestic cats except for registered breeders.
attributes.background:
Animal shelters are always full of unwanted or abandoned cats.   I cannot understand why you wouldn't care for your sentient family member. 
Hypothetically, one unneutered female could be responsible for over 20,000 descendants in five years
attributes.additional_details:
Facts and Figures via Cats Protection	
Estimations of one to two million stray cats.
•	Over 150,000 stray and abandoned cats enter shelter care in the UK every year
•	In 2016 we helped around 500 cats a day
•	Cats Protection rehomed 43,000 cats in 2016
•	Cats Protection reunited 3,000 cats with their owners in 2016
In 2016 CP trapped, neutered and returned 20,000 feral cats.
CP runs the largest single species neutering programme in the world.

Lack of Money is no excuse - help is available
CP can help with the cost of neutering and micro-chipping if you receive State Benefits or are on a low income.  The RSPCA also have a voucher scheme.

attributes.action: Produce statutory guidance on how universities should support Dyslexic students.
attributes.background: Dyslexics learn differently. They are put at a disadvantage in today's educational system. Dyslexics should be given the same opportunity to reach their potential.
attributes.additional_details: I am dyslexic. I was lucky enough to receive a lot of support throughout my education. However, when I started university, my dyslexia became more apparent. I found it very difficult to learn from the teaching style. Moreover, the majority of my work was not marked in conjunction with my SPLD cover note. After speaking to my dyslexia help tutor, I learned that many lecturers do not believe in dyslexia. Therefore, the government should introduce statutory guidance to universities on how they can support dyslexic students. For example, by recommending compulsory seminars/training for staff.

attributes.action: Raise the legal sex age to 18 years of age
attributes.background: Under 18 years of age we are classed as children therefore children can not make a decision on sexual intercourse as they will not have the correct mentality and full understanding to do so. This will also allow for children to get through further education instead of becoming teenage parents.
attributes.additional_details: At the age of 16 we are told that sexual intercourse is okay when that just is not the case. If you're not ready to be parents you should not be having sexual intercourse at 16 you should be planning on what you are going to do at college, not worrying about being a parent, and as explained you should be an adult to be a parent not a child.

attributes.action: Mandatory training for Police and DV Agencies about DV Issues in BME Communities
attributes.background: In 2014 a mother and her baby daughter died as a result of a vicious attack by an ex-partner/the child's father. A Domestic Homicide Review report found that police made many mistakes which contributed to their deaths. Research has shown that African heritage people are less likely to report abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Issues undeniably ours such as reduced likelihood of equal treatment, inappropriate reference points, increased likelihood of not being believed or taken seriously, repeated need to explain our cultural norms and language which result in us constantly educating and consoling others before we receive support.

attributes.action: Ensure direct train services are maintained/improved to London from Surrey Heath
attributes.background: In recent times a direct train to London Waterloo, servicing residents from Surrey Heath (Frimley, Camberley and Bagshot) was introduced. This allowed commuters three direct trains in the morning and two returns in the evening. This is now under threat from new train franchise operator SWR.
attributes.additional_details:
SWR took over the franchise in Aug 2017. The previous operator SWT invested in extended platforms, to accommodate this service.

This is due to be removed in 2018.

Please support this pertition to prevent this vital service being removed.

attributes.action: Outlaw and enforce the sale of V5 and V5C vehicle registration documents.
attributes.background:
The V5C registration document is the property of the DVLA and by law needs to be surrendered when a vehicle is disposed of. 
Sadly there is a black market of traders selling V5's and V5C's with or without VIN plates facilitating the change of a vehicle identity. Ringing kits for stolen vehicles.
attributes.additional_details:
By selling a vehicle identity knowingly or not (remember ignorance is no defense) they could well be aiding and abetting the theft of a motor vehicle and should face the same penalties as anyone who is an associate before or after the fact. 

Banning the sale of V5, V5C, VIN plates and other documentation; and enforcing the existing laws more diligently it would effectively cut off the tide of illegal vehicle identity sales thus helping reduce the number of vehicle thefts in the UK.

attributes.action: Strip arriva rail north of the franchise as they are not giving customers 100%
attributes.background: We want to the government to strip arriva rail north of the franchise as the company are failing everywhere - trains delayed, they're getting rid of guards. As a company they are awful they don’t care about the customer they care about profits. Let’s get TransPennine operating the northern lines

attributes.action: Make a fair, set amount of maintenance per child and not 25% of income!
attributes.background: Non resident parents (NRP's) are paying far too much to the resident parent of their child/children. This is causing severe depression and suicidal tendencies in NRP's. NRP's have to try and provide for their families at home whilst paying out a huge 25% plus of their income to their ex partners.
attributes.additional_details: The government decide how much an adult requires to live on so people on jobseekers allowance receive the same amount from one person to the next. Why is it the more a working NRP earns the more they have to pay the other parent? Why does the child suddenly require more money because the NRP has got a better job or worked overtime. NRP's often work extra hours to try and compensate for CMS/CSA payments and then they are required to pay the other parent more because their income has increased?

attributes.action: Force motorway service areas (MSAs) provide security for visiting HGVs at night.
attributes.background: I am the operator of a single lorry. In two months I have had six holes cut in my trailer curtains and a braking system cable stolen while at MSAs. Parking at MSAs costs up to £34. I have been told by an operator that they don't have to do any more. Damage, load and fuel theft happens very often.
attributes.additional_details:
Returning to secure yards increases empty mileage, emissions and costs. It also increases fleet sizes and congestion. Some loads can't be delivered in one day and require overnight parking away from base.
A security guard from 20:00 to 06:00 would cost an MSA around £102, just 4 trucks per night. 
The cost of my repairs is £850 + VAT (approx) in 8 weeks, equal to a drivers wage. Increased costs for firms mean higher prices at the shops.
Visit http://ninefiftysix.co.uk/tag/petition-2018/ for more

attributes.action: Extend Abdulla Alhindawe's UK Visa
attributes.background: Abdulla Alhindawe is a courteous young, social and friendly person. As some of you may know Abdulla was diagnosed with Lymphoma in 2017 and fought the battle and won. The NHS recommends for anyone who has been diagnosed with Lymphoma to stay in the UK for 5 years after treatment is complete.
attributes.additional_details: However Abdulla is in the UK because of his dad coming to the UK on a student visa. Abdulla was due to go back to Iraq in June 2017 but to his illness his visa was extended to April 2018, meaning Abdulla will have to leave at the start of April 2018. Where Abdulla lives in Iraq there is a 50% chance of death by bombing at any given moment. Also his visa was not extended to consider the 5 years that NHS recommends to anyone diagnosed with Lymphoma.

attributes.action: Make bereavement benefits accessible to cohabiting parents
attributes.background: Bereavement payments are designed to aid families who may have lost a significant portion of their income due to the death of a loved one. However, these payments are only accessible to the spouse or civil partner of the deceased. Children of unmarried couples are eligible for nothing.
attributes.additional_details: On the 8th of December my partner took his own life. Myself and my daughter have been left in a difficult situation and are not eligible for any bereavement support simply because we weren't married.

attributes.action: Make Philip Hammonds Brexit Preperation Fund the NHS Fund instead.
attributes.background:
Philip Hammond said in his Autumn 2017 Budget: 
“We have already invested almost £700 million in Brexit preparations, today I am setting aside over the next two years another £3 billion. And I stand ready to allocate further sums if and when needed”.

Let’s Fund our NHS Instead!

attributes.action: Stop the setting of homework for children until the age of 14 in the UK.
attributes.background:
Homework is killing our children’s love of learning.

We need to remove the unnecessary pressure and stress of homework.  We need to liberate our children to enjoy the fun and freedom in life.
attributes.additional_details: I do believe that work beyond the classroom becomes relevant and important as children embark on their GCSE and A Levels.  I also believe that there is an argument for determined practice but this needs to be driven from within and a desire to learn and succeed; not a product of relentless persuasion from a parent.   Unfortunately, by the time children reach GCSE, homework has become an arduous task with little meaning or benefit.  It is purely a task which has to be endured; there is no investment or passion.

attributes.action: Debate the Whip system in the House of Commons for a major reform of the system.
attributes.background: A major reform of the whips system is essential to bring back meaningful debate to parliament.  The power of the whips inhibits democracy and encourages a herd instinct and mindlessly partisan behaviour. The power Whips currently hold encourages a lack of integrity and independent thought.
attributes.additional_details: The roles of the whips are secretive, but they appear to influence who sits on committees to question government ministers and having some say over who becomes chairman of the committee. They have too much power and too much say over what happens to MPs. Coercing, threatening or otherwise telling elected MPs how to vote should be outlawed. The notion of "whipping" members into the voting lobbies is yet another slap in the face of democracy and only benefits the party and executive branch.

attributes.action: Create long-term answer to homelessness. Give rough sleepers services and a say.
attributes.background: There are more than 250,000 homeless people in the UK. We want them to be granted the same rights to health and social care as the rest of us. We want a full inquiry into the roots of homelessness and long-term solutions to it. Homeless people also need to be given a bigger say in decision-making.

attributes.action: Publish a breakdown of any Brexit money agreed after negotiations are complete
attributes.background: It would seem reasonable that if we are to pay any figure to the EU on Brexit that the British public should know specifically what we are paying this money for in the form of a detailed breakdown. Particularly since the legal basis for paying any money is in doubt.
attributes.additional_details:
https://youtu.be/2Xu-hI9Ci4U

http://johnredwoodsdiary.com/2017/01/29/there-is-no-legal-basis-for-making-any-extra-payments-to-the-eu/

attributes.action: Stop the CUTS to our armed forces.
attributes.background: The MOD have announced that our armed forces will be cut over the next few years. If this happens it means our Navy, Army and Air Force won't be able to defend this country by conventional means, and would have to rely on our nuclear capabilities instead.
